oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impact of Organic farming on aquatic environment
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kristensen, Erik Steen
Knudsen, Marie Trydemann
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nutrient turnover
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effects of conversion to organic farming on N leaching are discussed in the presentation. Problems in European aquatic environment are presented along with the development of organic farming in Denmark and the rest of Europe. Recent Danish studies on the N leaching effects by conversion of mixed dairy and arable farms are presented. The studies estimate that N leaching is lower from organic compared to conventional mixed dairy farms, whereas N leaching at organic arable farms are comparable to conventional arable farms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kristensen, Erik Steen and Knudsen, Marie Trydemann (2004) Impact of Organic farming on aquatic environment. Speech at: Lednice, Lednice, 1st July 2004.
